projectName: The Court of the Crimson King
description: The Court of the Crimson King is a 2D, rouge-like, turn based RPG created using Unity and C#. The game follows the main character as they progress through four randomly generated dungeons of varying length, complete randomized quests, gather gold and monster, and fight bosses along the way in their efforts to stop King Crimson. The game features a combat system with different effects such as poison, burn, paralysis, and more. Gather potions and items to help you progress through the game as you train your monsters. The game is thematically music based, meaning all monsters are based off different songs, albums, and artists. You even can listen to the opposing monsters’ songs as you battle your way through the dungeon.
myRole: This project was a semester long project with me and two other people. I worked as a PM dividing up tasks since I was really the only one with a large prior experience of Unity. In addition to project management I mainly worked on procedural dungeon generation, save management, data management, quest/dialogue management, and UI management.

description: My Canvas dashboard was more of a personal project to gain experience. Users can register an account through my website using their canvas ID and key. Users then are shown their different assignments due in a monthly calendar. Users then can add different tasks to the calendar which will be saved to a database.
myRole: This was a solo project, so I did all of the work myself.

description: Leinecker’s Leins is an up to eight player fishing game. Players can use one computer and up to eight mobile devices to play the game. Players must login on their mobile devices to join the website lobby using a game code. The players phones then turn into a fishing pole and the website turns into a fishing competition.
myRole: This was a half semester long project which I worked with one other in the mobile side. I did all the programming and development of our mobile Unity application, and my partner worked on the art.
